text:
Generally, agricultural employees of an agricultural
employer are covered by the OSHAct, and OSHA has promulgated several standards
for the protection of the safety and health of agricultural workers (29 CFR
1928).  These standards include rules for sanitation facilities in the field
(29 CFR 1928.110).  A separate OSHA standard requires sanitation facilities in
temporary labor camps (29 CFR 1910.142). When conducting an OSHA Field Sanitation
inspection/investigation statutory coverage must first be established followed
by regulatory coverage under 29 CFR 1910.142 and 1928.110. 52 Fed. Reg. 16050-01, 1987 WL 142266 (F.R.)
html:
Generally, agricultural employees of an agricultural employer are covered by the OSHAct, and OSHA has promulgated several standards for the protection of the safety and health of agricultural workers (29 CFR 1928).  These standards include rules for sanitation facilities in the field (29 CFR 1928.110).  A separate OSHA standard requires sanitation facilities in temporary labor camps (29 CFR 1910.142).

 

When conducting an OSHA Field Sanitation inspection/investigation statutory coverage must first be established followed by regulatory coverage under 29 CFR 1910.142 and 1928.110.

 

52 Fed. Reg. 16050-01, 1987 WL 142266 (F.R.)
